instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.SMC_ADPAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADPAPTER_EN? This is a typo of SMC_ADAPTER_EN When you see SMC_ADPAPTER_EN, assume they meant to type SMC_ADAPTER_EN.
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
Hi Guys!
I just got another Board for fix and i need find out what happen with <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> rail.
When i inject 5V on the rail the fan spinning
I don't get 1.1v in <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: History? Liquid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: Just stop one day.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: Need more info. PPBUS at 12.6v? <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> present? Green light?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: Yes, i have both.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: Come on man, give me some more info than that!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.61
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.42V (green Light)
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.33v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> - 0V

- Resistance to ground in <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 3.700K[COLOR=#666666][FONT=arial]Ω[/FONT][/COLOR]
- No light on the mouse
- When i inject 5v, the fan start spinning, but the CPU won't turn on (no hot)
- When i plug the battery, fun dont spinning, but CPU/VIDEO turn on (hot)
- Original Charge 85W

threads.message: [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> / <TRANSISTOR>Q7920</TRANSISTOR> = 3.42v

Thank you

threads.message: ​[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] [USER="1"]larossmann[/USER]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: Check voltages after <RESISTOR>R1800</RESISTOR>,1,2,3. Check 32Khz on pin 12 of <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] I check the voltage on <RESISTOR>R1800</RESISTOR>/01/02/03 and then i get 3.32v
About <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>, i can't bc i don't have oscilloscope.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: Wait, when you plug in a battery the CPU/GPU get warm and these is no <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL>??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: Is <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> stuck at 0v? Also, duke's question.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: Yes, i Get 0V on <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> (<CHIP>U2890</CHIP>)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: Like i said: I just get <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL> when i plug the battery. Just charge, no.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
I give up, this is what you said last week:

When i plug the battery, fun dont spinning, but CPU/VIDEO turn on (hot)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
I keep saying :
When I connect the battery + charger the CPU and VIDEO get warm, also i dont have fan spinning.
Only charger , I do not get 5v also CPU and video.
I dont get 5V only from the charger.
That's why I'm here trying to learn from you how to find out .
I understand your engineer mood , but I 'm not here to learn how to "give up" in five steps , sorry .
U can help , just need more patience with anyone who is willing to learn something from you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: You are probably using a fake 85W charger so it will not power on from AC alone. If <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL> is present the fans must spin.
